summary: This document is a series of internal Bureau of Prisons communications regarding the psychological and medical observation of inmate Jeffrey Epstein at the Metropolitan Correctional Center on July 28, 2019. It details his complaints of physical symptoms (numbness in arm and neck), his request to delay a return to the Special Housing Unit (SHU), and the staff's assessment that he is psychologically stable and will be transferred to the SHU.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The inmate being observed and discussed in the medical/psychological log. He complains of numbness in his right arm and neck, sleep issues due to sleep apnea, and requests to stay in a 'safe' area rather than return to the Special Housing Unit (SHU).

persons.name: Lopez
persons.context: Another inmate (ID #20472-038) who is being taken off of psychological observation on the same day, as noted in the administrative bedspace list.

events.title: Epstein's Psychological and Medical Observation
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein is under psychological observation at the Metropolitan Correctional Center. He reports numbness in his right arm and neck, sleep issues related to sleep apnea, and a running toilet in his cell. Staff assess him as psychologically stable and plan his transfer to the Special Housing Unit (SHU) for the following day.

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center, 150 Park Row, New York, New York 10007
SW/Hospital area (likely the Special Watch or hospital area within the facility)
keyFacts: On July 28, 2019, Jeffrey Epstein was under psychological observation at the Metropolitan Correctional Center in New York.
Epstein complained of physical symptoms including numbness in his right arm and neck, and attributed potential memory impairment to sleep apnea. He was expecting a CPAP machine.
Epstein requested to remain in the current area because he felt it was 'safe,' but staff informed him he would be returned to the Special Housing Unit (SHU) the next day.
Bureau of Prisons staff assessed Epstein as 'psychologically stable' and found no mental health issues precluding his return to the SHU.
The document records administrative details, including the plan to move Epstein to the SHU pending bedspace and the removal of another inmate (Lopez) from psychological observation.
